cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 85 miles north of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north-northeast across the eastern Gulf, forecast to cross Florida’s Big Bend Wednesday and track across south-central Georgia toward the Georgia–South Carolina coast, then move offshore into the Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (near Cedar Key to Indian Pass)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Altamaha Sound, Georgia to South Santee River, South Carolina
weather_observation.warning_coast: Sebastian Inlet, Florida to Altamaha Sound, Georgia
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast (Englewood to Indian Pass), then the southeast U.S. coast from northeast Florida through Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 35-45 mph with higher gusts) are likely Wednesday night into early Thursday, with a 65 % chance of 34-kt winds and an 18 % chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of surge possible in the mouth of the Savannah River and adjacent Georgia–South Carolina coastline under the present Storm Surge Watch.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher totals could trigger flash and urban flooding in and around the port Wednesday night–Thursday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents and the potential for a few tornadoes in outer rainbands.
